title: maymar2323
author: maymar2323
content: Hello,I have a somewhat unusual request. Namely, it is about an erroneous transaction. I accidentally sent an unlisted token to my KuCoin address. The amount has been credited to my address, but does not show up in my KuCoin account, it only shows up in the block explorer.I have been in contact with support for some time now, however I am constantly being turned away and not directed to the technical department. Since KuCoin have the private keys to this address, there is also a technical way to recover the tokens from my KuCoin address.Support has already admitted that the tokens can be saved once they implement the token. Only no one can tell me if this will ever happen.So now my call to the community: I offer 1000 USD of the saved amount to the person who provides the crucial help to save the tokens.Maybe someone who knows a member of the technical team at KuCoin and persuades them to take up my case. As I said, the support refuses to take up the matter, although I have already assured that I will pay for their effort.I can send a screenshot of my KuCoin account and the link to the address in Block Explorer if needed. So everyone can make sure that this is a real request and not a scam.Anyone who can help me, please drop me a personal message.Thanks

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: I don't think anyone can help you here except Kucoin support. Here is no external service which can change anything (legally) in the Kucoin backend.You probably need to be more persistent, or maybe you didn't talk to the right person there, some of the exchanges will transfer your wrongly moved token/coin for a certain fee, ask them.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: No one here can able to help you with sending the wrong coin/token to your exchange account. The exchange support is the only one that could help you with your token but according to the Kucoin article here https://www.kucoin.com/news/en-deposit-to-wrong-addressIt is gone forever and they can't do anything. Since you already contacted them and they said that they will recover your token once the token is already listed on their platform. Why not contact the developer of that token and try to request to add this token to Kucoin?What exactly is the token are you talking about?

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Why here? Â There's no KuCoin support team here that will help you out, if there is, that might a scammer.Be careful now when anyone asks to help you, they might ask for your KuCoin information to steal left there. Contact support and state your issue, they will surely help you out with this problem.They had an article relevant to your problem, What Should I Do If Deposit Wrong Crypto?It might help you to figure out the process on this request and watch this Youtube video from that article. Good luck and be patient, you're very lucky if there's a quick response from them.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: I think Kucoin support can help you with that alone. Even you offer 1k here, someone might just pretend to help you with the process and scam you.If the token credited on the exchange isnt supported by them, the chance is slight, especially it will take time for them to get that but I think its not impossible. But if the expenses for recovering that ia huge Im sure could negotiate and bargain with them. But honestly a mistake like that is a sin on crypto. You should always be careful on dealing with sending funds. They always have a warning to not send tokens not supported by their exchange and might got loss.

comments.author: maymar2323
comments.body: Of course it is my fault. I converted a test amount of the token to the native coin and successfully sent it to my receiving address on KuCoin.Then the next day I did the same with the main amount again, only I forgot to convert the token to the coin first and then send it. Instead, I mistakenly sent the token directly.Since both addresses are identical and the address was suggested to me directly by my sending wallet, I unfortunately only noticed the error afterwards.The support is just brushing me off. I think they just have the policy of not retreiving tokens manually. Binance instead is offering this service for a fee.This is the problem, the technical solution exists, I just cannot get to a technician directly because support is shielding them off.This is why I call for your help desperately, I just would need the right contacts to get the retreiving process going. So if anyone of you could connect me to the right persons inside KuCoin and they retreive the token, I would pay you the bounty.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: That's a pain in the ass if the support themselves are the ones turning you away, thus no one can help you in here even if someone knows their technical department.Actually, they can really retrieve those tokens that you've mistakenly sent to that address but I don't know if they have certain rules and regulations about mistakenly sent tokens and they can no longer be retrieved once you're at fault.What I can say is that continue negotiating on them if this is a big amount and continue talking to them to get back that money of yours.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: maymar2323 on August 08, 2022, 07:35:41 PMHello,I have a somewhat unusual request. Namely, it is about an erroneous transaction. I accidentally sent an unlisted token to my KuCoin address. The amount has been credited to my address, but does not show up in my KuCoin account, it only shows up in the block explorer.I have been in contact with support for some time now, however I am constantly being turned away and not directed to the technical department. Since KuCoin have the private keys to this address, there is also a technical way to recover the tokens from my KuCoin address.Support has already admitted that the tokens can be saved once they implement the token. Only no one can tell me if this will ever happen.So now my call to the community: I offer 1000 USD of the saved amount to the person who provides the crucial help to save the tokens.Maybe someone who knows a member of the technical team at KuCoin and persuades them to take up my case. As I said, the support refuses to take up the matter, although I have already assured that I will pay for their effort.I can send a screenshot of my KuCoin account and the link to the address in Block Explorer if needed. So everyone can make sure that this is a real request and not a scam.Anyone who can help me, please drop me a personal message.ThanksFor what you said you accidentally send it to your Kucoin address then most provably no people from here can help you about your issue, Maybe try to reach out the Kucoin support directly then try if there's a chance that you can recover your money. This incident is consider as loss but if you give a try to contact them from time to time and tell them if it possible to be claim then state that you are willing to pay a convenience fee for recovery maybe they will take action to your issue.

comments.author: Yawa2020
comments.body: This is a very technical issue that is supposed to be handled by KuCoin technical departments but since you said you've been in contact with them but been turned down, I will suggest you reach out to payback team thou I'm not too sure if they can handle your issue. This is the link to their site and mail address respectively.payback websitepayback mail addressYou can give it trial. Goodluck!

comments.author: Laurendaldin
comments.body: I'm sorry that this happened but this forum is clearly not the place where someone can help you. If support can't help, maybe you can negotiate with the token developer. In any case, be careful there is even a warning about such situations

comments.author: Lucius
comments.created_time: August 09, 2022, 12:14:34 PMLast edit: August 09, 2022, 01:19:17 PM by Lucius
comments.body: The chances that you will find someone who has connections within that exchange on this forum are little or none, although it costs you nothing to try. Their policy in such cases is very clear, but your problem is specific considering that they do not support that token - which further complicates the whole situation.From everything I have had the opportunity to read over the years, most CEX avoid such procedures because they represent a security risk, and this is also something that cannot be done by any employee, but specially trained persons. Maybe your best chance is to listen to the advice and take a detour in the sense of trying to convince the owner to try adding that token to the exchange.Edit :I didn't know there was an official BTT account of that exchange, so there is someone you can complain to even on the forum.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2592830

comments.author: 5W-KILO
comments.body: Only the exchange team have access to that address's private key, anyone telling you that they will help is deceiving you, do not send money to anyone because it's impossible to get your asset back, only the exchange team can help you.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Yawa2020 on August 09, 2022, 11:07:48 AMI will suggest you reach out to payback team thou I'm not too sure if they can handle your issue. This is the link to their site and mail address respectively.payback websitepayback mail addressDo not advertise that scam here, it's a scam company known for taking money upfront for your case, and then you're not going to hear a word from them anymore, fake reviews, fake statements, a shell company with a shady license and ten phone operators, nothing else.QuoteDisclaimer: Payback Ltd offers each new client a free consultation. Funds Recovery or other services that will be subsequently commissioned will incur fees and/or commissions, based on the service and the complexity of each individual case. Payback Ltd doesnât offer any investments, financial services, or advice.The services provided by Money Back LTD are conditioned by the clientâs signature on the service agreement. The fixed-fee paid for services rendered in the relevant engagement with each customer, is not refundable and is not conditioned by the results. They are tricking you with free consulting and then charging you thousands of dollars each month for their service of looking for the coin.

comments.author: Yawa2020
comments.body: Quote from: stompix on August 09, 2022, 02:51:23 PMDo not advertise that scam here, it's a scam company known for taking money upfront for your case, and then you're not going to hear a word from them anymore, fake reviews, fake statements, a shell company with a shady license and ten phone operators, nothing else.QuoteDisclaimer: Payback Ltd offers each new client a free consultation. Funds Recovery or other services that will be subsequently commissioned will incur fees and/or commissions, based on the service and the complexity of each individual case. Payback Ltd doesnât offer any investments, financial services, or advice.The services provided by Money Back LTD are conditioned by the clientâs signature on the service agreement. The fixed-fee paid for services rendered in the relevant engagement with each customer, is not refundable and is not conditioned by the results. They are tricking you with free consulting and then charging you thousands of dollars each month for their service of looking for the coin.I actually have not any deal with them before. A friend recommended it to me when I lost some funds to scammers and after I emailed them, they replied that the funds I lost is not up to the amount they will like to handle the case. So I just let go of the issue and move on. Have you ever had a deal with them? Throw more lights please so people should not fall victim.

comments.author: 2stout
comments.body: Not sure if the will answer, but you may want to ask KuCoin if/when they plan on listing the coin and be prepared to wait it out.Â  Could be tough if the coin was delisted.Â  Can also try this if you haven't already:Â  https://kucoin.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fkucoin.zendesk.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F8353401857945-How-to-Apply-for-Token-Recovery-from-Specific-Types-of-Wrong-Deposit-Withdraw#:~:text=Coins%20that%20have%20not%20been%20listed%20yet%20will,to%20retrieve%20it%20via%20self-service%20of%20token%20recovery.

comments.author: maymar2323
comments.body: Quote from: 2stout on August 10, 2022, 05:15:37 AMNot sure if the will answer, but you may want to ask KuCoin if/when they plan on listing the coin and be prepared to wait it out.Â  Could be tough if the coin was delisted.Â  Can also try this if you haven't already:Â  https://kucoin.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fkucoin.zendesk.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F8353401857945-How-to-Apply-for-Token-Recovery-from-Specific-Types-of-Wrong-Deposit-Withdraw#:~:text=Coins%20that%20have%20not%20been%20listed%20yet%20will,to%20retrieve%20it%20via%20self-service%20of%20token%20recovery.The wording of the link seems interesting, but it only says "You're not authorized to access this page" for me. Can you please elaborate?

comments.author: maymar2323
comments.body: Quote from: 5W-KILO on August 09, 2022, 02:38:57 PMOnly the exchange team have access to that address's private key, anyone telling you that they will help is deceiving you, do not send money to anyone because it's impossible to get your asset back, only the exchange team can help you.I guess you are right, I somehow need to persuade the KuCoin team to take on my case. I am willing to pay all of their efforts, I already offered them the 1000 USD as well. But all I receive are standard replies, regardless of what I write to them.

comments.author: 2stout
comments.body: Quote from: maymar2323 on August 11, 2022, 02:59:06 PMQuote from: 2stout on August 10, 2022, 05:15:37 AMNot sure if the will answer, but you may want to ask KuCoin if/when they plan on listing the coin and be prepared to wait it out.Â  Could be tough if the coin was delisted.Â  Can also try this if you haven't already:Â  https://kucoin.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/signin?return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fkucoin.zendesk.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Farticles%2F8353401857945-How-to-Apply-for-Token-Recovery-from-Specific-Types-of-Wrong-Deposit-Withdraw#:~:text=Coins%20that%20have%20not%20been%20listed%20yet%20will,to%20retrieve%20it%20via%20self-service%20of%20token%20recovery.The wording of the link seems interesting, but it only says "You're not authorized to access this page" for me. Can you please elaborate?Yes, basically you have to already be signed into your for the link to work as this is contained in the url- signin but hold on.Â  After poking around and to save you a little time, here is the direct link, appears it is accessible without login but you might have to login to submit a case:Â  https://www.kucoin.com/support/900006117646-What-Should-I-Do-If-Deposit-Wrong-Crypto- Let me know if this winds up working for you.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Unfortunately, I don't think you will get the help you need on the forum. Not only that but you might become a good target for a scammer who will try to retrieve and steal some of your personal information, phish you, or try to scam you in some other way.I only see two legit ways you can go about this:1. Keep insisting to speak with someone responsible for coin recovery.2. Wait for the asset to be listed on KuCoin. And when/if it is, contact the support department again and ask them to recover your coins.Unless the total value of the lost coins is a significant one, most exchanges don't want to bother with things like this. Since you are offering a bounty of $1000, I can only assume that you have lost a few grands at least. That might still not be an amount the exchange would be bothered to recover. It might sound harsh, but unfortunately that's how they look at things.When you spoke with the support and asked them to recover your coins, did you tell them/did they ask the value of the deposit? Did you have to submit a transaction ID?

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.created_time: August 12, 2022, 08:32:33 AMLast edit: August 29, 2022, 03:19:54 PM by LoyceMobile
comments.body: Search for cross chain deposits, it has happened before. Some exchanges are willing to help, some do it in batches once in a while, and some don't do it at all.An exchange isn't the same as someone with a private key, after many hacks any decent exchange now doesn't have as single employee with such access, meaning it's expensive and risky for them to recover.
